Dating: BYZANTINE PERIOD (not before); BYZANTINE PERIOD ?; COPTIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Fragment of moulding
Description: This fragment of moulding in limestone is decorated by foliage and two gazelles, characterised by their large round eyes. The surface of the relief is flat; carved marks designate the veins of the leaves and the freize of ovals sketched on the lower listel. The iconographic theme of foliage accompanied by animals appears in Byzantine and Coptic architecture and also on fabrics. The fragment dates from the 6th or 7th century.
